get.description: Returns a list of products ordered by id. Use `catalog_id` and `query` parameters to filter products.

schema.description: Search term. Searches by name and sku.
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: Search term. Searches by name and sku.

post.description:
Creates a chat with specified phone number or username. Returns an existing chat if it already exists.

If a new chat or a new contact have been created, `created_chat`/`created_contact` will be true.

You may pass `contact_id` to link the chat to an existing contact, if it's not linked to any other contact yet.

get.description:
Check if messages could be sent to the chat. **Only for WABA**.

`is_available` will be `true` if it's possible to send a free-form message to the chat.
    This means that you
    `'have enough dialogs balance' AND ('have auto templates enabled' OR 'have dialog session open').`

`is_available` will be `false` otherwise

To find out why the chat is not available, check the following in order:
1) Check `waba.dialogs_available`. If it's `false`, then you must top up your dialogs balance
2) Check `waba.expires_at`. If it's in the past, then the dialog session has ended.
    You must wait for an incoming message from the recipient or send a template message.
3) Check `waba.auto_templates_enabled`. If it's `false`, then you must send a template message

post.description:
Uploads a file to Radist to be used with messaging API later.

Max file size: **100MB**

You can specify desired file name in the `filename` field of multipart request.

get.description:
Returns counts of remaining dialogs by connection type.
Returns **estimated** value for WhatsApp Business API.

post.description:
Body params:
1. `custom_name` - name of the template in Radist.
2. `template_name` - name of the template in FB. If not provided, will be auto-generated, based on `custom_name`.
3. `template_locale` - full list available [here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/supported-languages)
4. `category` - consult with [FB guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/updates-to-pricing/new-template-guidelines/) to choose the right one.
5. `allow_category_change` - set to `true` to avoid template rejection due to miscategorization. Including this parameter will allow Meta to assign whatever category they determine to be appropriate.
6. `components` - list of template components. Only body is required, others are optional. Check out [FB reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/components) and our components schema for more details.
7. `examples` - if you use variables in your templates (e.g. {{1}} in body, or header with file attached), you must provide examples to avoid template rejection.

Given `connection_id` & `template_name`, deletes the WABA template with that name.
It will delete template in **ALL languages.**
Upload a file for WhatsApp Business API template moderation.
Upload a file for WhatsApp Business API profile picture.

schema.description: Search by phone (e.g. +18001234567). Mutually exclusive with `query`

post.description:
Creates a new tag.

`name` must be unique within company (case-sensitive, i.e. TagName != tagname).

put.description:
Updates an existing tag.

`name` must be unique within company (case-sensitive, i.e. TagName != tagname).

post.description:
Creates an authentication session for Telegram.

To create a new connection, provide one of (`auth_type=code & phone`) or (`auth_type=qr`).

To authenticate with an existing connection, provide `connection_id & auth_type=code|qr`.

Authenticates session in Telegram.

You may have to call this method 2 times if 2fa is enabled in telegram app.

For `auth_type=code`:
    First, only with `session_id` & `code`. Second, with `session_id`, `code`, `password`.

For `auth_type=qr`:
    First, only with `session_id`. Second, with `session_id`, `password`.
Sends a logout request to telegram.

get.description:
Returns counts of remaining dialogs by connection type.
Returns **estimated** value for WhatsApp Business API.

Get partner profile.

`name` - Partner's name.

`promo_code` - Partner's main promotional code.

`referral_promo_code` - Partner's referral code.

`commissions` - Partner's commissions.

Client who use the promo codes during registration will be linked to the partner.

Get a list of clients linked to the partner.

`id` - Client company id.

`name` - Client company name.

`waba_dialogs_balance` - Number of available WABA dialogs.

`waba_360dialog_partner_id` - 360Dialog partner id (used for WABA payments).

`paid_until` - Date until which the subscription is paid. The closest payment date among all subscriptions is taken.

`test_until` - Date until which the subscription is in test mode. If paid_until = test_until,
it means the subscription is in test mode.

Get information about the client company.

`id` - Client company id.

`name` - Client company name.

`waba_dialogs_balance` - Number of available WABA dialogs.

`waba_360dialog_partner_id` - 360Dialog partner id (used for WABA payments).

Get a list of subscriptions from client company.

`id`- Subscription id.

`connections` - List of connections in the subscription.

`connections[0].id` - Connection id.

`connections[0].type` - Connection type.

`connections[0].name` - Connection name.

`connections[0].phone` - Connection phone number (if connection type is whatsapp, waba, telegram).

`subscription_type` - Subscription type.

`current_size` - Number of connections in the subscription.

`paid_until` - Date until which the subscription is paid.

`test_until` - Date until which the subscription is in test mode. If paid_until = test_until, it means the
subscription is in test mode.

Get a list of notification channels for client company.

`id` - Notification channel id.

`name` - Notification channel name.

`type` - Notification channel type.

`whatsapp.phone` - Phone number which will receive notifications (only for type=whatsapp).

`params.events` - List of events that will trigger notifications.

`params.partner_companies` - List of partner companies to receive notifications from.

Get a list of requisites from client companies.

`id` - Requisite id.

`tin` - Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN).

`name` - payer name.

`approval_status` - Status of the requisite verification.

post.description:
Create an invoice for the client company.

**Request:**

`preview` - If true - preview mode, false - invoice issued, client can pay.

`items` - List of items (items[0] - description of the object for subscription payment,
items[1] - for WABA dialogs payment.)

`payment_method` - Payment method (CARD_RU - payment by Russian card; CARD_OTHER - payment by foreign card;
 BANK_TRANSFER - bank transfer payment)

`period_months` - Number of months for which the subscription is paid.

`company_requisite_id` - Requisite id (If payment_method = BANK_TRANSFER).
Can be issued to client's requisites or your own.

`promo_code` - Promo code.

`partner_email` - Partner's email, for receipt.
Handle Max Personal login authentication flow.
